description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ae476","text":"This SOP includes animal prep and scanner setting up for scout and radial k-space sampling of diffusion weighted MRI of mouse abdomen.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fk6p5","text":"This SOP includes a brief Diffusion weighted MRI protocol that consists of following major steps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ocvs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2gbml","text":"1. Animal Preparation and induction of general anesthesia","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aa64h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbude","text":"2. MRI calibration and acquisition of Radial diffusion weighted MRI","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3hm0e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72md9","text":"3. Animal recovery","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dl956","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hafj","text":"Animal Preparation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"758t4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"121kq","text":"Animal should be transferred from the home cage to anesthesia box connected to isoflurane.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"46b39","text":"MRI Scanner Calibration, Scout and T2W MRI ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eoemb","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6nies","text":"Open ParaVision 6.0.1 for generating a new study. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ca71h","text":"  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3i6h","text":"1. Localizer initiation:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1tqi2","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f47p5","text":"1. After generating a new study, a localizer can be selected from the scan programs and protocols drop down menu. For initiating a localizer, locate the appropriate protocol in the scanner interface/software. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1l999","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kl51","text":"2. Generally, a simple short T1-weighted image with a single slice in each orthogonal direction can provide enough spatial information to ensure that the animal is properly placed underneath the coil (Figure 3 (Panel (A)).  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":222,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8svar","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1acj","text":"3. Prior to initiating the scan, a series of calibration/shimming is performed automatically by the scanner including the following steps: ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67voc","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"er88v","text":"i. Wobble-tuning and matching of the RF coil.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2la69","text":"ii. Set the basic frequency","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8k4ve","text":"iii. Perform shimming","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"g9di","text":"iv. Set the reference power","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6q8ek","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9d7ai","text":"2. Selecting the first study protocol:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14hvu","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7986h","text":"i. Select the first study scan protocol from the protocol list. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a742k","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3t19v","text":"ii. Drag and drop the desired protocol into the instruction panel. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gle","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtp78","text":"ii. Select T2_Turbo with RARE technique custom named as T2_TurboRARE_tumorsize (FOV=30x30, Slice thickness=1.00 mm, no. of averages (NA)=8) to obtain the coronal images.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5msn","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vesn","text":"iii. Click on apply to run the scan.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eh9b7","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4d356","text":"iv. Duplicate the first scan and increase the number of slices to cover the entire tumor with (number of averages=12) in axial direction for calculating the tumor size. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pklp","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7n4d0","text":"v. Click on apply to run the scan.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f68dg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f3gl2","text":"iv. The third scan T2_Turbo with RARE technique custom named T2_TurboRARE_30ms_axial can be set using the images obtained from the first scan. A preset FOV, NA, Slice thickness, number of slices were used according to the protocol (Figure 3 (Panel (B)). ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26uct","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agiok","text":"vi. In this study under geometry the read offset and phase offset were kept as zero. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgrku","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1944n","text":"vii.Turn on Autoshim then Mapshim and tick the automatic shim volume. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7bg6g","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7brdr","text":"viii. Click on apply to run the scan.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mthj","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50okh","text":"v. Before running the third scan the Bo inhomogeneity map can be obtained.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"an06s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r9cj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4l9or","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0D61CFB07D3711EC991A81556A5697D2","height":309,"id":277742,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Figure 3.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/irhsbni97.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/irhqbni97.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/irhrbni97.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/irhpbni97.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"74hkt","text":"Setting up Radial-Diffusion-weighted MRI","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":40}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7509","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vjik","text":"i. To set up the Radial spin echo diffusion weighted scan select the custom named as RadSEDW_5bvalues sequence.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50b91","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0bgu","text":"ii. Copy the T2_Turbo with RARE technique in axial plane sequence parameter to RadSEDW_5bvalues sequence from the drop-down menu.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45e4s","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ng4n","text":"iii. Check the geometry again and then click on apply to start the sequence.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hvq","text":"Induction of general anesthesia","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctd0h","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2vb2","text":"i. Keep the animal under the isoflurane in an anesthesia box for sedation. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"al1as","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2vkp","text":"ii. Animal should then be properly sedated for transferring it to the animal bed. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5u1lv","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3of5m","text":"iii. Anesthesia can be achieved via nose cone attached to the animal bed (Figure 1 Panel (A))  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":93,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cpcj8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F81FC3A07D3611EC991A81556A5697D2","height":309,"id":277746,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Figure 1.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/irhwbni97.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/irhubni97.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/irhvbni97.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/irhtbni97.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"13blf","text":"Place the mouse in with the vital signs monitoring:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":51}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fvav","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rilc","text":"1. Once the animal is properly sedated, secure the pneumatic pillow under the thorax of the animal to record proper breathing (Figure 1 Panel (C)). ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fou2g","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2l86i","text":"2. Insert the temperature rectal probe into the animal rectal using a lubricant for monitoring the temperature (Figure 1 Panel (C)).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9dpl5","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45ogf","text":"3. Tape the animal properly to the animal bed to avoid any movement during the scanning ((Figure 1 Panel (C)).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"am8c6","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mho0","text":"4. Position the animal bed in the coil in a position which exposes the tumor-bearing region in the center of the magnet by measuring from the center line printed on the top of the coil (Figure 1 Panel (D)).","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cl01s","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1u50","text":"5. Now place the coil in center of the magnet using a non-metal yardstick.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6076f","text":" ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"caogv","text":"6. Connect the temperature probe and respiration probe to the ERT module.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a25vj","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edk9a","text":"Note: Remember to always continue monitoring the animal vitals when it is on the scanner (Figure 2).  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":95}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":100,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1dn03","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4l37d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cp3v9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"057093E07D3711EC991A81556A5697D2","height":309,"id":277750,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Figure 2.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/irh2bni97.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/irhybni97.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/irhzbni97.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/irhxbni97.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bf289","text":"Remove and Recover Mice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1simn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2khhn","text":"i. Upon completing the scan the RF coil/mice bed assembly are removed from the scanner. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"28rmo","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24o1s","text":"ii. Vital sign probes are removed from the mouse before anesthesia is turned off. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ubei","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9d4i4","text":"iii. The mouse should be recovered from the anesthesia by keeping it warm either using the warm pads or preheated operation table warmed at 37°C. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qfjq","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57l71","text":"iv. After the mouse is recovered well it can be returned to its home cage.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
